answer:
Adult immunizations are available from many pharmacies in BC.  It's best to call ahead to confirm vaccine availability.  Adult immunizations are also available by appointment from many public health units in BC. You can find the contact information for your local public health unit here.  Some family physicians also provide immunizations.
For more information on adult immunization, visit our adult immunization page.
answer_formatted:
## Adult immunizations are available from many pharmacies in BC.

It's best to call ahead to confirm vaccine availability.

## Adult immunizations are also available by appointment from many public health units in BC.

You can find the contact information for your local public health unit here.
Some family physicians also provide immunizations.
For more information on adult immunization, visit our adult immunization page.
question: i need to get my polio vaccine, do i need to set up an appointment or can i just walk in with my care card
question_variation_0: need to set up appointment to get vaccine vaccination?
question_variation_1: need to sign up appointment for vaccine
question_variation_2: can i take care of an appointment on a care card without setting up an appointment?
